summaryText: Wow, what an incredible Easter Sunday message from Pastor Travis Hearn! In this powerful sermon, Pastor Travis explores the profound question: 'What are you really looking for in life?' Drawing from the resurrection story and Solomon's experiences in Ecclesiastes, he passionately reveals that most people are essentially 'chasing the wind' - pursuing everything from relationships to success, but finding no true satisfaction. The heart of the message? Jesus is the only answer to our deepest longings! Pastor Travis breaks down four compelling reasons to try Jesus: He offers a fresh start, true peace, hope for the future, and a genuine relationship with God. I love how he candidly shares his own journey, from wearing a cross as a 'good luck charm' to truly understanding what it means to know Christ. The most powerful moment? When he challenges everyone to ask, 'Why not try Jesus? What have you got to lose?' This isn't just a sermon, it's an invitation to a transformative relationship with the risen Savior.
mainPoints: Jesus offers a fresh start and new beginning
Only Jesus provides true, supernatural peace
God offers hope and restoration, even when life doesn't turn out as we planned

versesMentioned.text: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!
Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.

Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.
For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Jesus replied, 'Very truly I tell you, no one can see the kingdom of God unless they are born again.'
For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

Monday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Monday.focus: Embracing your new identity in Christ
Monday.action: Write down three old habits or mindsets you want to release, and three new characteristics you want to develop as a new creation in Christ.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me fully embrace my new identity in You. Show me the old ways I'm still holding onto and give me strength to let them go. Renew my mind and transform my heart. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Philippians 4:6-7: 'Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God.'
Tuesday.action: Create a 'peace journal' where you document areas of stress and intentionally surrender them to God through prayer.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my anxieties to You. Fill me with Your peace that surpasses understanding. Help me trust You completely in every situation. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Wednesday.action: Spend time reflecting on your current fears about the future. Write a letter to yourself from God's perspective, reminding you of His promises and love.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, help me trust Your plans. Remove my fears and replace them with hope and confidence in Your guidance. Show me the future You have prepared for me. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Thursday.action: Identify one area where you've been trying to control the outcome. Physically write down a prayer of surrender, symbolically releasing it to God.
Thursday.prayer: God, I surrender my need to control. Help me trust You completely and lean not on my own understanding. Guide my steps and direct my path. Amen.

Friday.scripture: John 3:16: 'For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.'
Friday.action: Perform an unexpected act of kindness for someone, reflecting God's sacrificial love.
Friday.prayer: Father, help me understand and reflect Your incredible love. Use me today as an instrument of Your grace and compassion. Show me someone who needs to experience Your love through me. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 1 Peter 1:3: 'Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! In his great mercy he has given us new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.'
Saturday.action: Spend time journaling about the new life and hope you have in Christ. Reflect on how He has transformed you.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, thank You for the living hope I have in You. Continue to renew my mind, transform my heart, and guide me in Your purpose. I am grateful for the new life You've given me. Amen.
